name: Cern-rpmverify
body: ### Description cern-rpmverify is designed to detect changes in the files that are installed by rpm packages. It will log the changed files as well as the rpm packages that they belong at the local syslog facility. Configuration files are ignored, because they are supposed to be changed. You need root priviledges to execute cern-rpmverify, otherwise all the files that need root privileges will be ignored. *IMPORTANT* If you want to run a more strict rpm verification, execute 'rpm -V --all'. With this command you will get information about not only changed files, but changes in permissions etc. ### Format of the log messages Feb 9 14:50:23 localhost python: cern-rpmverify: started Feb 9 15:04:02 localhost python: rpmverify: File /usr/bin/catchsegv from package glibc-common-2.12-1.47.el6 has been modified Feb 9 15:04:04 localhost python: rpmverify: File /usr/bin/consolehelper from package usermode-1.102-3.el6 has been modified Feb 9 14:55:15 localhost python: cern-rpmverify: finished ### Support or Contact CERN CERT
tagline: Verifies the integrity of the files which are installed by rpm packages
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
